work.summary: Led an effort in Software Engineering Center to improve talent acquisition and retention.
highlights: Added an emphasis on hiring for both hardware and software skills for test and measurement roles.
Expanded the duration of on site interviews and greatly expanded their technical scope.
Added an emphasis on system level thinking in the interview process.
Organized an effort to ensure that new hires would get real work, to improve morale and retention.
Performed resume and phone screening, along with on site interviews.

work.position: VIIRS Ground Support Equipment Responsible Engineering Authority
work.summary: VIIRS (Visible Infrared Imaging Radiometer Suite) is a calibrated spaceborne sensor used for weather prediction. It undergoes extensive pre-launch testing with spacecraft and ground station simulators.
highlights: Engineering owner of the ground station and spacecraft simulators for VIIRS test program.
Made the case for, designed, and wrote a rewrite the simulator software. (~40,000 lines of C++)
Designed and built an adapter board for cheap commercial communications hardware to be used.
Redesigned the simulator to support SpaceWire connectivity to support VIIRS upgrades.
Designed, built, and maintained an automated data aggregation  system. Reduced analysis time from hours to less than 5 minutes.
Provided 24/7 on call support for several months of continuous testing
As a result of upgrades, test program had a marked (80%) reduction in errors caused the simulators.

work.position: Capital Test Station: Electrical and Software Architect
work.summary: Raytheon owned test station, built to support customer programs and internal R&D. A grounds up new design adding significant new capabilities to Raytheon.
highlights: Gathered electrical and software requirements for the test station
Designed an overall hardware and software architecture to satisfy the requirements
Selected all the components to be used, did the interconnect, wiring, and mechanical design
Designed a web based back end data store and api for both configuration data and telemetry using C#, HTML, ASP.NET MVC, and XML-RPC (~10,000 lines)
Built a client for the api that could be consumed by typical LabVIEW programmers
Worked closely with the LabVIEW front end group, resulting in smooth integration

work.summary: Worked in the vision group of the NTT Behavioral Research Lab in the NTT Atsugi R&D Center
highlights: Research on human material color perception focusing on specular and matte reflection's effects on inference materials and illuminants in a scene
Experimented with Machine vision techniques for manipulating specular and matter reflection
Designed and built an electromechanical optical system which controlled light polarization to separate matte and specular components of a scene.

work.summary: Instructed physics students in a hands on laboratory environment.
highlights: Physics 105, Analog Circuits Laboratory: theory and the practice of designing, analyzing, and constructing analog circuits. Components included passives, transistors, and operational amplifiers.
Physics 6, Sophomore Laboratory in Physics: mass spectroscopy, analysis of resonant circuits, resonant mechanical systems, light spectroscopy, and diffraction of electrons by crystalline solids
